Name: Aviation incident/aircraft relationship
Description: This is a compound-value type containing information about aircraft that have been involved in accidents, crashes, and other incidents.

Properties.Name: Aircraft model
Properties.Description: The model of (one of) the aircraft involved in this incident. Note that this should be a model, such as Boeing 747 or Sopwith Camel.

Properties.Name: Crew
Properties.Description: The number of crew on this flight.

Properties.Name: Flight destination
Properties.Description: The airport (helipad, carrier, etc.) to which the aircraft was headed.

Properties.Name: Flight origin
Properties.Description: The airport (helipad, carrier, etc.) from which the aircraft took off.

Properties.Name: Operator
Properties.Description: The owner of this aircraft. This will usually be a company (such as an airline) or a military service, but owners of private aircraft can also be entered.

Properties.Name: Passengers
Properties.Description: The number of passengers on this flight. (Different from the "passengers" property of Aviation Incident, which is the sum of the passengers of all aircraft involved.)

Properties.Name: Survivors
Properties.Description: The total number of passengers and crew of this aircraft who survived this incident. (Different from "total_survivors" property of Aviation Incident, which is the sum of survivors of all aircraft involved.)

Properties.Name: Tail number
Properties.Description: The tail number (if any) of this aircraft.
